inference:
The sum of the three angles is $2\pi$, so $a+b+c+d=2\pi$. Since $a,b,c$ take up $\frac{1}{3},\frac{1}{4},\frac{1}{6}$ of the circle respectively, we have:
$$\frac{a}{2\pi}=\frac{1}{3}\Rightarrow a=\frac{2\pi}{3}$$

$$\frac{b}{2\pi}=\frac{1}{4}\Rightarrow b=\frac{\pi}{2}$$

$$\frac{c}{2\pi}=\frac{1}{6}\Rightarrow c=\frac{\pi}{3}$$

Therefore, $d=2\pi-a-b-c=2\pi-\frac{2\pi}{3}-\frac{\pi}{2}-\frac{\pi}{3}=\frac{\pi}{2}$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{\pi}{2}}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Angle $d$ covers $1-\frac13-\frac14 -\frac16 = 1 -\frac26-\frac16 - \frac14 = 1 -\frac12 - \frac14 = \frac14$ of the circle, so it has measure $\frac14\cdot 360^\circ = \boxed{90^\circ}$.
